mdRecord.dcterms:title: Deed, granted to Giles Brent, Junior, 1654 September 6
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bennet, Richard
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Clerical copy of a deed. On September 6, 1654, Richard Bennet Esq. granted a thousand acres of land along the south bank of the Potomac River in Westmoreland County, Virginia to Giles Brent Junior. The plot of land did, incidentally, become a part of the Mount Vernon River Farm. George Washington purchased the tract of land in 1760 and at that time may have acquired and annotated this clerical copy of the 1654 deed. On the verso of the document, George Washington's inscription reads, "Copy, Richd Bennet, Esq., Grant, To Giles Brent for 1000 acs of Ld, 6th Septr 1654."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Westmoreland County (Va.)
Fairfax County (Va.)
